Package base

Class Man

java.lang.Object
base.Man
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, Movement
Direct Known Subclasses:
Alcalde, Alguacil, Baker, Blacksmith, Butcher, Carpenter, Farmer, Fisherman, Fishmonger, Lumberjack, Miner, Shepherd
public class Man extends Object implements Comparable, Movement
Base object to create differents type of human beigns. Each Man have some unique attributes:

- name: A random name generated by the object AleatoricName
- ID: A unique ID for each Man
- HP: Starting life pointes
- money: A Money object with the amount parameter of how much money the man have
- mapX: The X position of the Man in the board
- mapY: The Y position of the Man in the board
- speed: How much squares the Man move on the board
- icon: The icon of the man, used to draw the man on the toString() method
- inventory: A Inventory object to store all the items the Man have

The mapX and mapY attributes of the man does not place the object on the map. To do that it is necessary to use the next method of Board:
addSomething(Object Man, mapX, mapY)

Also implements the Movement interface to allow the man move on the board.

Author:
Fernando Tarrino del Pozo (FernandoEsra)

  • Constructor Details

    • Man

      public Man()

    • Man

      public Man(int ID, int HP, Money money, int mapX, int mapY, int speed, String icon)
      Its it possible to change the lenght of the name by change the minName and maxName variables inside the constructor. Default its between 3 and 10
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the Man. For the correct execution of the methods it is recommended not to repeat IDs.
      HP - Starting life points.
      money - A Money object with the starting money.
      mapX - The starting X position on the board.
      mapY - The starting Y position on the board.
      speed - The starting speed (squares per turn).
      icon - The icon of this man.

    • addMoney

      public void addMoney(Money newMoney)
      This method read a Money object and add the money to the money of this man.
      Important: This method does not subtract money of the object that is passed as input parameter.
      Parameters:
      newMoney - A Money object to read the amount and add that amount to te actual money of the man

    • subtractMonet

      public boolean subtractMonet(double totalToSubtract)
      This method subtract a double valor of the actual money of the man. But first check if it possible (the man have enough money)
      Parameters:
      totalToSubtract - A double quantity to subtract for the actual money.
      Returns:
      false if the man does not have enough money
      true If it has been possible to make the operation

    • update

      public void update(int newX, int newY)
      Update the (newX).(newY) coordinates of the man. This method does not check anything. Like if it is possible to place the update man on the new coordinates. That should be done with board methods.
      Parameters:
      newX - A new value for this.newX
      newY - A new value for this.newY
